name: execute-aas-tsml
description: Executes a TMSL Script on an Azure Analysis Service instance
author: Jan Pieter Posthuma

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure RM Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription.

inputs.name: aasServer
inputs.label: Analysis Services Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Analysis Services Server name, like 'asazure://westeurope.asazure.windows.net/fabrikam'.

inputs.name: appId
inputs.label: Application ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Application ID of the Service Pricipal

inputs.name: appKey
inputs.label: Application Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Key for the Service Principal. It can accept variable defined in Build/Release Definitions as e.g. '$(spkey). You may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: adminName
inputs.label: Analysis Services Admin
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Analysis Services admin login

inputs.name: adminPassword
inputs.label: Analysis Services Admin Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the Analysis Services Admin. It can accept variable defined in Build/Release Definitions as e.g. '$(passwordVariable). You may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: tsmlFile
inputs.label: TMSL File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the TMSL file on the automation agent or on a UNC path accessible to the automation agent like, \\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\Fabrikam.tsml. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here.

inputs.name: tsmlScript
inputs.label: Inline TMSL Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the TMSL script to execute on the Azure Analysis Service instance selected above.

inputs.name: tmslFolder
inputs.label: Path to Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the path to a folder with the TMSL script to needs to be execute on the Azure Analysis Service instance selected above.

inputs.name: ipDetectionMethod
inputs.label: Specify Firewall Rules Using
inputs.helpMarkDown:
For successful execution of the task, we need to enable administrators to access the Azure Database for MySQL Server from the IP Address of the automation agent.
By selecting auto-detect you can automatically add firewall exception for range of possible IP Address of automation agent â€‹or else you can specify the range explicitly.

inputs.name: startIpAddress
inputs.label: Start IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The starting IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.50 .

inputs.name: endIpAddress
inputs.label: End IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ending IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.65 .

inputs.name: deleteFirewallRule
inputs.label: Delete Rule After Task Ends
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, the added exception for IP addresses of the automation agent will be removed for corresponding Azure Database for MySQL.

inputs.name: targetAzurePs
inputs.label: Azure PowerShell Version
inputs.helpMarkDown:
In case of hosted agents, the supported Azure PowerShell Version is: 1.0.0(Hosted VS2017 Queue).
To pick the latest version available on the agent, select "Latest installed version".

For private agents you can specify preferred version of Azure PowerShell using "Specify version"

inputs.name: customTargetAzurePs
inputs.label: Preferred Azure PowerShell Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Preferred Azure PowerShell Version needs to be a proper semantic version eg. 1.2.3. Regex like 2.\*,2.3.\* is not supported. The Hosted VS2017 Pool currently supports Az module version: 1.0.0
